content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the command "list_files" to get a list of files in the current directory, which included "my_file.txt". Then, I executed a Python file using the command "execute_python_file" with the argument "filename" set to "Atlas/executed_code/my_script.py". The command returned a message from my computer saying it was executed. Afterward, I used the command "browse_website" to visit the Wikipedia page for Python programming language and asked "What is Python?". The command returned a message from my computer with an overview of Python's design philosophy, features, history, and implementations. The message also included links to various pages on Wikipedia.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "get_hyperlinks", "args": {"url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Python_(programming_language)"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Failure: command get_hyperlinks returned too much output.                         Do not execute this command again with the same arguments.', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "get_text_summary", "args": {"url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Python_(programming_language)", "question": "What is Python?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command get_text_summary returned:  "Result" : an overview of the Python programming language, including its history, features, syntax, and various implementations. It highlights Python\'s versatility and popularity in a wide range of applications, such as scientific computing, web development, and artificial intelligence. The text also includes resources and references related to Python, such as books and software libraries.', type='action_result')]
"""
